findings:
- Cardiomegaly with cardiac silhouette measuring approximately 7.5 cm transverse diameter (normal <5.0 cm), suggesting enlargement of the heart.
- Pulmonary vasculature appears prominent, with increased pulmonary artery and bronchial artery markings, indicating possible pulmonary hypertension or volume overload.
- Bilateral lower lung fields show increased opacity with hazy, ground-glass appearance, most prominent in the posterior segments, suggestive of interstitial or alveolar infiltrates.
- No pleural effusions or pneumothorax identified.
- No obvious consolidation, lobar collapse, or mass lesions.
- Diaphragm appears flattened, particularly on the right side, consistent with elevated intra-abdominal pressure or chronic lung disease.
- No visible rib fractures or sternum abnormalities.
- No mediastinal shift or deviation.
- Trachea is midline.
- No calcifications or foreign bodies detected.
impression:
- Cardiomegaly with possible congestive heart failure.
- Bilateral pulmonary infiltrates consistent with interstitial pneumonia or pulmonary edema.
- Elevated pulmonary vascular markings suggestive of pulmonary hypertension or left ventricular dysfunction.
- Consider chronic lung disease or volume overload states.
full_response:
Findings: - Cardiomegaly with cardiac silhouette measuring approximately 7.5 cm transverse diameter (normal <5.0 cm), suggesting enlargement of the heart.
- Pulmonary vasculature appears prominent, with increased pulmonary artery and bronchial artery markings, indicating possible pulmonary hypertension or volume overload.
- Bilateral lower lung fields show increased opacity with hazy, ground-glass appearance, most prominent in the posterior segments, suggestive of interstitial or alveolar infiltrates.
- No pleural effusions or pneumothorax identified.
- No obvious consolidation, lobar collapse, or mass lesions.
- Diaphragm appears flattened, particularly on the right side, consistent with elevated intra-abdominal pressure or chronic lung disease.
- No visible rib fractures or sternum abnormalities.
- No mediastinal shift or deviation.
- Trachea is midline.
- No calcifications or foreign bodies detected.
Impression: - Cardiomegaly with possible congestive heart failure.
- Bilateral pulmonary infiltrates consistent with interstitial pneumonia or pulmonary edema.
- Elevated pulmonary vascular markings suggestive of pulmonary hypertension or left ventricular dysfunction.
- Consider chronic lung disease or volume overload states.
